title: Best literature and fiction of March, as chosen by the Editors
description: Beware the Ides of March, but not the books on our best-of list this month, which includes a clever retelling of a beloved classic, the latest from the author of There There, a novel that doubles as a love letter to Los Angeles, and more.

title: What to read next: 'Dune,' the new Tommy Orange, and more
description: Wondering what to read next? This week, the Amazon Editors serve up a wide range of books—from new ones just hitting shelves (or your doorstep) to classics that are soon to be appearing on the big screen.

title: What to read after 'Atomic Habits'
description: Breaking bad habits is one of the most popular New Year's resolutions, and there is perhaps no more famous book than Atomic Habits to help you do just that. James Clear's seminal self-help book has sold more than fifteen million copies since its 2018 release, and still tops charts today.

title: Tasty 'Goon With the Spoon' recipe: mozzarella-stuffed turkey meatloaf
description: For tasty treats and flavorful cocktails, mouth-watering comfort food, and dishes that are sure to please a crowd, look no further than Snoop Dogg Presents Goon With the Spoon.

title: The NetGalley Team's Most-Anticipated Books of 2024
description: A new year is only a few weeks away, and that means it's time to start working on a new TBR list. As you can imagine, the NetGalley team loves looking ahead to see which books are coming out next.

title: What to read next: buzzy books from Rebecca Yarros, Tess Gerritsen, and more
description: Wondering what to read next? The Amazon Editors have some great recommendations for you—whether you're looking to read a buzzy book of the moment, a book that will turn your bad day into a good day, or a book that is perfect for your entire family.
